title-group.article-title: "And Rebecca Loved Jacob", But Freud Did Not

p.mixed-citation: Carolyn Heilbrun in her afterword to the collection of essays Daughters and Fathers (1989, 418;
"The fear of castration being thus excluded in the little girl, a powerful motive also drops out for the setting-up of the super-ego" (Freud 1924, 178).
"Why it is that throughout your work you have concen- trated so exclusively on patricide, why only the Oedipus complex and not a 'Cain complex', has remained an enigma to me" (1991, 92).
Everett Fox's note to his trans- lation of this phrase in his In the Beginning, New York: Schocken Books, 1983:13
